descript.abstract:
This spreadsheet includes Minnesota sales tax information for the years 2003-2009. Data includes total amount of sales tax collected (state, county, city, and special purpose levies) and the number of businesses in the geographic area.
Data are unduplicated and reported in one of four general categories:
1. Records outside of Minnesota are reported at the state level and include territories, APO's, foreign and unassigned.
Within Minnesota, records are assigned to one of three geographic levels (blockgroup, city or county):
2. Within the 7-county Twin Cities metro area, records are assigned to blockgroups. 3. Outside of the 7-county Twin Cities metro area, records are assigned to cities with populations greater than 2,000 residents. 4. All other unassigned Minnesota records are tabulated by county.
For additional information and statistical reports, please visit http://www.revenue.state.mn.us/research_stats/Pages/Whats-New.aspx
Note: The positional accuracy of many locations for years 2003-08 has been improved in this version, therefore, anyone using this data should download and replace any previous version.
descript.purpose: This dataset details sales tax information and the number of businesses in each geographic area across the state.
descript.supplinf: Minnesota, and other areas outside the state that pay Minnesota sales tax

timeperd.current: This data begins in the 2003 tax year, for taxes filed in 2004, and is current to the 2009 tax year, for taxes filed in 2010. Further updates are on hold due to a problem caused by a change in census block group boundaries in 2010. The change could make it possible to reverse engineer the data by splitting some of the old and new block groups in order to get more precise tax numbers as they pertain to a particular business; a way needs to be found to prevent this possible data disclosure.

place.placekey: Minnesota, MN, Twin Cities, 7 County Metro

idinfo.useconst:
By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of this metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user.
We recommend that other interested parties download this dataset from the Minnesota Geospatial Commons to ensure that the most current data is obtained (see Ordering Instructions).

attracc.attraccr:
Attributes are deemed accurate but not error free. This data is administrative in nature and may be misrepresentative due to changing filing requirements or other administrative functions.
Records are assigned to the respective geographic area through geocoding of the listed address on the filed tax return, thus introducing an unknown, presumably small, level of error to the data through incorrect addressing.
It must also be noted that this dataset ONLY covers sales tax, and does not include the use tax or other forms of taxation. These figures do include total sales tax, which includes the state portion along with any county, city, and special purpose levies. It does not include nor factor into the aggregated figures any information about businesses who failed to pay Minnesota sales tax. Please visit the Sales Tax page on the Minnesota Department of Revenue's website for additional information on filing requirements and guidelines: http://www.revenue.state.mn.us/businesses/sut/Pages/File-and-Pay.aspx
IMPORTANT: The 7 records listed for the 7 metro counties are each the total of unmatched tax returns for those counties and are NOT the aggregate for each county. The 7 counties are: Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.
Geographic areas with fewer than 10 businesses have been suppressed to ensure compliance with privacy laws.

dataqual.complete:
The entire state of Minnesota is included.
Data are unduplicated and reported in one of four general categories:
1. Records outside of Minnesota are reported at the state level and include territories, APO's, foreign and unassigned.
Within Minnesota, records are assigned to one of three geographic levels (blockgroup, city or county):
2. Within the 7-county Twin Cities metro area, records are assigned to blockgroups. 3. Outside of the 7-county Twin Cities metro area, records are assigned to cities with populations greater than 2,000 residents. 4. All other unassigned Minnesota records are tabulated by county.
Geographic areas with fewer than 10 businesses have been suppressed to ensure compliance with privacy laws.

horizpa.horizpar:
Geographic boundaries are taken from U.S. Census Bureau TIGER files for 2008: http://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/data/tiger-line.html
Individual records are linked back through previous years in order to provide better positional precision. For example, if a point for 2008 is a rooftop match, and the address hasn't changed since 2003, the same blockgroup is assigned to all intervening years, even though the 2003 match only provided the city.

procstep.procdesc:
Addresses, taken from the Minnesota Sales Tax forms, are geocoded using a variety of software packages, including MapMarker (MapInfo), EDQ (FirstLogic), and ZP4 (Semaphore). Problematic addresses, such as those on a boundary of two geographic areas, are manually assigned to a geographic area by Minnesota Department of Revenue staff.
The total number of returns for each geographic area are then used to compute the total amount of collected sales tax and the total number of businesses.
Data from geographic areas with fewer than 10 businesses is then suppressed to comply with privacy laws.
Additional processing step added in 2010: Individual records are linked back through previous years in order to provide better precision. For example, if a point for 2008 is a rooftop match, and the address hasn't changed since 2003, the same blockgroup is assigned to all intervening years, even though the 2003 match only provided the city. Therefore, anyone using the data should download and replace any previous version.

spdoinfo.indspref: FIPAREA - 2 to 12 digit FIPS code representing State, County, City, or Block Group

overview.eaover:
FIPAREA -- Multi-jurisdictional FIPS code (text format) representing State, County, City, or Block Group
TYPEAREA -- FIPS level: State; Foreign; Unknown; County; City; Block Group
AREANAME1 -- FIPS name for all area types except for block groups
FIPST -- FIPS code for each state (2-digit, text format)
FIPCTY -- FIPS code for each county (3-digit, text format)
FIPSTCTY -- Concatenated FIPS codes for state and county (5-digit, text format)
FIPMCD -- FIPS codes for minor civil divisions (cities); if a city is located in more than one county, the portion of the city located in each county is a separate record with a different code (5-digit, text format)
FIPTRT -- FIPS code for each Census tract (6-digit, text format)
FIPBGR -- Single-digit indicating the Census block group within a given Census tract. A block group is a cluster of census blocks having the same first digit of their four-digit identifying numbers within a census tract. For example, block group 3 within a census tract includes all blocks numbered from 3000 to 3999. (Single-digit, text format)
STABBR -- Two-letter state abbreviation in all caps.
POP2000 -- Population from 2000 census
[IMPORTANT: For the attributes below, the 7 records listed for the 7 metro counties are each the total of unmatched tax returns for those counties and are NOT the aggregate for each county. The 7 counties are: Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington.]
SALESTAX3 -- Collected sales tax from 2003
SALESTAX4 -- Collected sales tax from 2004
SALESTAX5 -- Collected sales tax from 2005
SALESTAX6 -- Collected sales tax from 2006
SALESTAX7 -- Collected sales tax from 2007
SALESTAX8 -- Collected sales tax from 2008
SALESTAX9 -- Collected sales tax from 2009
BUSINESS3 -- Number of Businesses in 2003
BUSINESS4 -- Number of Businesses in 2004
BUSINESS5 -- Number of Businesses in 2005
BUSINESS6 -- Number of Businesses in 2006
BUSINESS7 -- Number of Businesses in 2007
BUSINESS8 -- Number of Businesses in 2008
BUSINESS9 -- Number of Businesses in 2009
NOTE -- Additional Information
Also note: Totals for all the sales tax fields are in the last row of the spreadsheet.

If you transmit or provide the Data (or any portion of it) to another user, the Data must include a copy of this disclaimer.
